Protocol.name: OrionPublic
Protocol.comment: The *OrionPublic* protocol is the packet description for the public interface of the Orion gimbal from [Trillium Engineering](http://w3.trilliumeng.com/). The Orion gimbal communicates to users with packets of data transported over asyncrhonous serial, or transported by TCP/IP over ethernet.

Documentation.name: Packet format
Enumerations
Documentation.comment: Packets in the protocol refer to these global enumerations.

Enum.name: OrionPktType_t
Enum.comment: Identifiers of Orion public packets. The purpose of an Orion packet is determined by its ID field to this list.

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CMD
Value.comment: Basic commands for control of gimbal pan and tilt.

Value.name: ORION_PKT_UART_CONFIG
Value.comment: Baud rate and protocol configuration for crown serial ports

Value.name: ORION_PKT_RESET
Value.comment: Send this packet to cause the gimbal to reset

Value.name: ORION_PKT_STARTUP_CMD
Value.comment: Command to run on startup at the end of motor initialization

Value.name: ORION_PKT_LIMITS
Value.comment: Pan and tilt limits for current, acceleration, velocity, and position

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CLEVIS_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the clevis board

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CROWN_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the crown board

Value.name: ORION_PKT_PAYLOAD_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the payload board

Value.name: ORION_PKT_TRACKER_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the tracker board (if present)

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SOFTWARE_DIAGNOSTICS
Value.comment: Diagnostic information related to software performance for a processor

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CAMERA_SWITCH
Value.comment: Command the gimbal to swtich cameras

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CAMERA_STATE
Value.comment: Command a camera in the gimbal

Value.name: ORION_PKT_NETWORK_VIDEO
Value.comment: Command the IP settings for video delivery

Value.name: ORION_PKT_VIDEO_OPTIONS
Value.comment: Settings for changing video processing and display

Value.name: ORION_PKT_TRACK_OPTIONS
Value.comment: Options for changing scene/object track configurations

Value.name: ORION_PKT_GEO_TRACK_COMMAND
Value.comment: GeoTracker Command Packet for setting filter

Value.name: ORION_PKT_VIDEORECORD_CLOCK
Value.comment: Get Current PTS of VideoRecord and PTS of PayloadRouter

Value.name: ORION_PKT_RETRACT_CMD
Value.comment: Retract or deploy command for a gimbal retraction mechanism

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SNPY_A8
Value.comment: Deprecated packet to be removed for 25.2

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SNPY_A9
Value.comment: Deprecated packet to be removed for 25.2

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SNPY_AA
Value.comment: Deprecated packet to be removed for 25.2

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SNPY_AB
Value.comment: Deprecated packet to be removed for 25.2

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SNPY_AC
Value.comment: Deprecated packet to be removed for 25.2

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SNPY_AD
Value.comment: Deprecated packet to be removed for 25.2

Value.name: ORION_PKT_DEBUG_STRING
Value.comment: A human readable text string which is typically used for debugging purposes

Value.name: ORION_PKT_USER_DATA
Value.comment: Packet for sending user data to a serial port in the gimbal

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SENSOR_DATA
Value.comment: Raw sensor data from the Orion Crown board.

Value.name: ORION_PKT_GPS_DATA
Value.comment: Raw GPS data input or output

Value.name: ORION_PKT_INS_QUALITY
Value.comment: Quality of the inertial navigation system

Value.name: ORION_PKT_GEOLOCATE_TELEMETRY
Value.comment: Information needed to locate the gimbal and its imagery

Value.name: ORION_PKT_GEOPOINT_CMD
Value.comment: Command the gimbal to go to Geopoint mode

Value.name: ORION_PKT_RANGE_DATA
Value.comment: Range information from the gimbal to its target

Value.name: ORION_PKT_PATH
Value.comment: Command the gimbal to path track mode

Value.name: ORION_PKT_INS_OPTIONS
Value.comment: Configuration options for the Inertial Navigation System

Value.name: ORION_PKT_STARE_START
Value.comment: Stare portion of step stare started

Value.name: ORION_PKT_NETWORK_SETTINGS
Value.comment: Change the IP network settings in the gimbal

Value.name: ORION_PKT_RETRACT_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the retract board (if present)

Value.name: ORION_PKT_LENSCTL_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the lens control board (if present)

Value.name: ORION_PKT_PRF_DETECT
Value.comment: Control and telemtry from Mira PRF detect enabled systems

Enum.name: OrionNumberOfCameras_t
Enum.comment: The maximum number of cameras in an Orion Gimbal

Enum.name: GimbalAxis_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration of gimbal pan and tilt axes.

Value.name: NUM_GIMBAL_AXES
Value.comment: Total number of axes in the gimbal

Enum.name: BodyAxis_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for body axis X, Y, Z arrays.

Value.name: AXIS_Y
Value.comment: Y points to the right (if X is forward)

Value.name: STATOR_U
Value.comment: First field of three phase motor

Value.name: STATOR_V
Value.comment: Second field of three phase motor

Value.name: STATOR_W
Value.comment: Third field of three phase motor

Enum.name: OrionBoardEnumeration_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration identifying different boards in the Orion Gimbal.

Value.name: BOARD_MISSCOMP
Value.comment: This value is deprecated and will be removed in 25.2

Enum.name: OrionMode_t
Enum.comment: The mode of operation of the gimbal.

Value.name: ORION_MODE_FAULT
Value.comment: Gimbal has experienced a fault and motors have been disabled

Value.name: ORION_MODE_RATE
Value.comment: Commands give the line of sight angular rate of the camera

Value.name: ORION_MODE_GEO_RATE
Value.comment: Inertial rate mode, with bulk motion compensation when valid slant range is available

Value.name: ORION_MODE_FFC_AUTO
Value.comment: Commands the gimbal to perform a flat field correction, pan and tilt will drive the IR camera to look at the black body

Value.name: ORION_MODE_FFC
Value.comment: Legacy FFC mode, alias of ORION_MODE_FFC_AUTO

Value.name: ORION_MODE_FFC_MANUAL
Value.comment: Commands the gimbal to perform a flat field correction, pan and tilt will drive the IR camera to the commanded positions. NOTE: The pan/tilt targets specify the payload position, not the boresight position, so the reported angles may not match the command target

Value.name: ORION_MODE_SCENE
Value.comment: Commands give the angular rate of the image produced by the camera

Value.name: ORION_MODE_TRACK
Value.comment: Commands give the angular position of the track box in the camera image as fraction from center, bound these numbers -0.5 to 0.5

Value.name: ORION_MODE_CALIBRATION
Value.comment: Drives the pan and tilt axes to calibrate the stabilization gyros

Value.name: ORION_MODE_NULL_GYROS
Value.comment: Hold gimbal still while stabilization gyro and IMU gyro biases are estimated. User ensures that crown will not move while in this mode.

Value.name: ORION_MODE_POSITION
Value.comment: Commands give the position of the pan and tilt axes with respect to the gimbal mount

Value.name: ORION_MODE_POSITION_NO_LIMITS
Value.comment: Commands give the position of the pan and tilt axes with respect to the gimbal mount. NOTE: This mode ignores the pan/tilt limits and can result in serious damage to the gimbal if used incorrectly

Value.name: ORION_MODE_GEOPOINT
Value.comment: Gimbal is pointing toward a fixed spatial location

Value.name: ORION_MODE_PATH
Value.comment: Gimbal is pointing toward a fixed path in space, and may be doing step-stare

Value.name: ORION_MODE_DOWN
Value.comment: Gimbal is pointing straight down, and may be doing step-stare

Value.name: ORION_MODE_UNKNOWN
Value.comment: Unknown gimbal mode. This is unused in normal operation and is strictly to maintain compatibility with v1.2

Enum.name: OrionMaxLasers_t
Enum.comment: The maximum number of lasers in an Orion gimbal.

Value.name: MAX_LASERS
Value.comment: Maximum number of lasers in an Orion gimbal.

Data.name: year
Data.comment: Years after 2000

Data.name: month
Data.comment: Month of the year, from 1 to 12

Data.name: day
Data.comment: Day of the month, from 1 to 31

Value.name: RANGE_SRC_SKYLINK
Value.comment: Range information from skylink terrrain lookup

Value.name: RANGE_SRC_INTERNAL
Value.comment: Range information is being estimated internally by the gimbal. Note that estimates are not guaranteed be accurate and should only be used as a fallback option.

Value.name: RANGE_SRC_INTERNAL_DTED
Value.comment: Range information estimated by the gimbal based on a DTED model

Data.name: Pos
Data.comment: Track box offset from the line of sight in radians

Data.name: Size
Data.comment: Track box size in percent of image width

Data.name: Confidence
Data.comment: Tracker confidence, from 0 to 1

Data.name: Active
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the track is active, or 0 if it is currently inactive

Documentation.name: Packets sent regularly by the gimbal
Documentation.comment: These packets are sent by the gimbal automatically, depending on the operational mode of the gimbal.

Data.name: systemTime
Data.comment: Milliseconds since system bootup

Data.name: gpsITOW
Data.comment: GPS time of week in milliseconds

Data.name: gpsWeek
Data.comment: GPS week number since Jan 6 1980

Data.name: geoidUndulation
Data.comment: Height of the geoid with respect to the WGS84 ellipsoid, in meters

Data.name: posLat
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude of the gimbal in radians, positive North

Data.name: posLon
Data.comment: Longitude of the gimbal in radians, positive East

Data.name: posAlt
Data.comment: Altitude of the gimbal in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: velNED
Data.comment: Velocity of the gimbal in North, East, Down meters per second

Data.name: gimbalQuat
Data.comment: Gimbal quaternion describing the rotation from the gimbal mount frame to the North, East, Down navigation frame

Data.name: pan
Data.comment: Gimbal pan angle in radians from -pi to pi. This includes the camera alignment offsets.

Data.name: tilt
Data.comment: Gimbal tilt angle in radians from -pi to pi This includes the camera alignment offsets.

Data.name: hfov
Data.comment: Horizontal field of view of the camera in radians from 0 to 2pi

Data.name: vfov
Data.comment: Vertical field of view of the camera in radians from 0 to 2pi

Data.name: losECEF
Data.comment: Vector from the gimbal to the image location in ECEF meters. The image location is only computed if ranging data are provided to the gimbal. Otherwise the image location data are 0,0,0

Data.name: pixelWidth
Data.comment: Active focal plane width in pixels

Data.name: pixelHeight
Data.comment: Active focal plane height in pixels

Data.name: mode
Data.comment: Operational mode of the gimbal.

Data.name: pathProgress
Data.comment: Distance along the path from 0 (the starting point) to 1 (the ending point). This only applies if the mode is ORION_MODE_PATH.

Data.name: stareTime
Data.comment: Seconds remaining in the stare portion of a step stare point, 0 if stare is not in progress. This only applies if the mode is ORION_MODE_PATH.

Data.name: pathFrom
Data.comment: Index of the path point gimbal is traveling from. This only applies if the mode is ORION_MODE_PATH.

Data.name: pathTo
Data.comment: Index of the path point gimbal is traveling to. This only applies if the mode is ORION_MODE_PATH.

Data.name: imageShifts
Data.comment: X (horizontal) and Y (vertical) instantaneous image shifts in radians

Data.name: imageShiftDeltaTime
Data.comment: The amount of time in seconds over which these shifts apply. If no new shift data has arrived since this packet was last transmitted then this will be 0

Data.name: imageShiftConfidence
Data.comment: Registration solution confidence, from 0 (no confidence) to 1 (full confidence).

Data.name: outputShifts
Data.comment: X (horizontal) and Y (vertical) image shifts in radians, as displayed in the video stream

Data.name: rangeSource
Data.comment: Range data source used in line of sight calculation

Data.name: leapSeconds
Data.comment: Leap seconds to subtract from GPS time to compute UTC time

Data.name: panAlignment
Data.comment: Pan camera alignment offsets in radian. The raw pan angle is given as pan + panAlignment.

Data.name: tiltAlignment
Data.comment: Tilt camera alignment offsets in radian. The raw tilt angle is given as tilt + tiltAlignment.

Value.name: insInGimbalNative
Value.comment: The INS is running in the gimbal native axis

Value.name: insInPlatform
Value.comment: The INS is running in the platform axis, see the INS options for specific roataion details

Value.name: insInPayloadBall
Value.comment: The INS is running in the payload ball.

Data.name: insRotationOption
Data.comment: This flag indicates special INS options. If insSpecialOption is 1 the INS is running in the gimbal crown, but is rotated from the gimbal native axis. If insSpecialOption is 2 the INS is running in the ball of the gimbal.

Data.name: insQuat
Data.comment: The rotation of the INS from its native frame to the North, East, Down navigation frame. If insSpecialOption is 0 then this rotation is the same as the gimbalQuat

Data.name: cameraIndex
Data.comment: Current camera index, or -1 if the gimbal does not include this field

Data.name: hasTrackData
Data.comment: Set to 1 if this packet includes object track data, otherwise 0

Data.name: primaryTrackData
Data.comment: Primary object track metadata

Packet.name: OrionPerformance
Packet.comment: Measurements related to stabilization performance. This packet is sent by the gimbal 4 times per second.

Data.name: RmsQuad
Data.comment: Quad rms errors

Data.name: RmsDir
Data.comment: Dir rms errors

Data.name: RmsVel
Data.comment: Vel rms errors

Data.name: RmsPos
Data.comment: Pos rms errors

Data.name: Iout
Data.comment: Output current

Packet.name: OrionDiagnostics
Packet.comment: Electrical diagnostic data for the Orion gimbal. This packet is sent by the gimbal every 3 seconds.

Data.name: Voltage24
Data.comment: Voltage of the 24-volt rail

Data.name: Voltage12
Data.comment: Voltage of the 12-volt rail

Data.name: Voltage3v3
Data.comment: Voltage of the 3.3-volt rail

Data.name: Current24
Data.comment: Current in Amps of the 24-volt rail

Data.name: Current12
Data.comment: Current in Amps of the 12-volt rail

Data.name: Current3v3
Data.comment: Current in Amps of the 3.3-volt rail

Data.name: CrownTemp
Data.comment: Temperature of the crown board in degrees Celsius

Data.name: SlaTemp
Data.comment: Temperature of the SLA-1500 board (if applicable) in degrees Celsius

Data.name: GyroTemp
Data.comment: Stabilization gyro ADC temperature in degrees Celsius

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: Voltage24Var
Data.comment: Voltage variance of the 24-volt rail

Data.name: Voltage12Var
Data.comment: Voltage variance of the 12-volt rail

Data.name: Voltage3v3Var
Data.comment: Voltage variance of the 3.3-volt rail

Data.name: Current24Var
Data.comment: Current variance in Amps of the 24-volt rail

Data.name: Current12Var
Data.comment: Current variance in Amps of the 12-volt rail

Data.name: Current3v3Var
Data.comment: Current variance in Amps of the 3.3-volt rail

Data.name: CurrentLaser
Data.comment: Current in Amps of the Lsr rail

Packet.name: OrionFault
Packet.comment: Let someone know when a fault occurs

Data.name: Type
Data.comment: Fault type enum

Data.name: Level
Data.comment: Fault level enum

Data.name: Component
Data.comment: Fault component enum

Data.name: Code
Data.comment: Fault code is fault type dependent

Data.name: Value
Data.comment: Fault value is fault type dependent

Packet.name: OrionSoftwareDiagnostics
Packet.comment: Diagnostic information related to software performance for a specific board in the Orion Gimbal. This packet is sent by the gimbal once per second.

Data.name: sourceBoard
Data.comment: Enumeration defining which board in the gimbal generated this message

Data.name: numCores
Data.comment: Number of CPU cores that this packet reports for

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: cpuLoad
Data.comment: CPU utilization as a percentage

Data.name: heapLoad
Data.comment: Heap memory utilization as a percentage, 0 if no heap is present

Data.name: stackLoad
Data.comment: System stack memory utilization as a percentage, 0 if no system stack is present

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: numThreads
Data.comment: Number of threads in the system, must be at least 1

Structure.name: ThreadLoading
Structure.comment: Per-thread information, in order of priority (highest to lowest)

Data.name: cpuLoad
Data.comment: CPU utilization of this thread as a percentage

Data.name: heapLoad
Data.comment: Heap memory utilization of this thread as a percentage, 0 if no heap is present

Data.name: stackLoad
Data.comment: Stack memory utilization of this thread as a percentage, 100 if stack overflow occurs

Data.name: watchdogLeft
Data.comment: Worst case amount of watchdog time remaining in this reporting period for this thread, 0 if watchdog has timed out

Data.name: numIterations
Data.comment: Number of times this thread iterated during the reporting period

Data.name: worstcase
Data.comment: Worst case thread run time as a ratio with the average thread run time during the reporting period

Packet.name: OrionVibration
Packet.comment: Platform vibration amplitude and frequency information. This packet is sent by the gimbal once every five seconds.

Data.name: MaxAccel
Data.comment: Maximum acceleration values, in m/s/s

Data.name: MaxGyro
Data.comment: Maximum angular rate values, in rad/s

Structure.name: FftData
Structure.comment: A series of points containing FFT-derived frequency and magnitude data

Data.name: Frequency
Data.comment: Frequency, in Hertz, of the data point defined by this element

Data.name: Accel
Data.comment: Acceleration magnitude, expressed as a percentage of MaxAccel

Data.name: Gyro
Data.comment: Angular rate magnitude, expressed as a percentage of MaxGyro

Packet.name: NetworkDiagnostics
Packet.comment: Ethernet network diagnostic information

Data.name: Flags
Data.comment: Ethernet interface configuration flags

Data.name: RxBytes
Data.comment: Ethernet bytes received

Data.name: TxBytes
Data.comment: Ethernet bytes transmitted

Data.name: RxPackets
Data.comment: Ethernet packets received

Data.name: TxPackets
Data.comment: Ethernet packets transmitted

Data.name: RxErrors
Data.comment: Number of receive errors

Data.name: TxErrors
Data.comment: Number of transmit errors

Data.name: RxDrops
Data.comment: Number of receive packets dropped by the Ethernet driver

Data.name: TxDrops
Data.comment: Number of transmit packets dropped by the Ethernet driver

Data.name: RxFifoErrors
Data.comment: Number of receive FIFO errors

Data.name: TxFifoErrors
Data.comment: Number of transmit FIFO errors

Data.name: FrameErrors
Data.comment: Framing error count

Data.name: Collisions
Data.comment: Hardware interface collision count

Data.name: CarrierErrors
Data.comment: Number of carrier loss events

Value.name: TLE_TYPE_NO_CHANGE
Value.comment: Appy settings to the currently active filter

Value.name: TLE_TYPE_ALIGN
Value.comment: The pan tilt alignment offset filter

Packet.name: TleStatus
Packet.comment: TLE algorithm status message

Data.name: SystemTime
Data.comment: Gimbal system time this status applies to

Data.name: FilterType
Data.comment: The filter this status relates to

Data.name: State
Data.comment: State of the filter (running or not)

Data.name: SampleCount
Data.comment: Number of samples used in the estimate

Data.name: Latitude
Data.comment: Filter's estimated latitude in radians

Data.name: Longitude
Data.comment: Filter's estimated longitude in radians

Data.name: Altitude
Data.comment: Filter's estimated altitude in meters above ellipsoid

Data.name: CE90
Data.comment: 90th percentile circular error radius in meters

Data.name: VE90
Data.comment: 90th percentile vertical error in meters

Data.name: SE90
Data.comment: 90th percentile spherical error in meters

Data.name: EllipseMajor
Data.comment: Confidence ellipse major axis in meters

Data.name: EllipseMinor
Data.comment: Confidence ellipse minor axis in meters

Data.name: EllipseAngle
Data.comment: Conifdence ellipse rotation in radians

Data.name: PanError
Data.comment: Cumulative pan error in radians

Data.name: TiltError
Data.comment: Cumulative tilt error in radians

Data.name: AltError
Data.comment: Cumulative altitude error in meters

Data.name: PanUncertainty
Data.comment: Pan uncertainty in radians

Data.name: TiltUncertainty
Data.comment: Tilt uncertainty in radians

Data.name: AltUncertainty
Data.comment: Altitude uncertainty in meters

Data.name: PercentOrbit
Data.comment: Percent of completed orbit to converge on an estimate

Packet.name: TleCommand
Packet.comment: TLE command message

Enum.name: TleOptions
Enum.comment: Options controlling what inputs TLE filter will use

Value.name: tleDefault
Value.comment: Use default options defined by the filter.

Value.name: tleIns
Value.comment: Include LOS measurements from the INS filter

Value.name: tleDted
Value.comment: Include altitude measurements using LOS and DTED lookups

Value.name: tleLrf
Value.comment: Include range measurements from laser range finder

Value.name: tleOffBoard
Value.comment: Include LLT measurements from offboard sources

Data.name: FilterType
Data.comment: The filter to start/stop

Data.name: Run
Data.comment: Start=1, Stop=0

Data.name: Options
Data.comment: Bitfiled of TleOptions flags.

Packet.name: OrionRetractStatus
Packet.comment: Current gimbal retraction mechanism status. This is sent by the gimbal regularly only if a retract system is installed.

Value.name: RETRACT_STATE_RETRACTING
Value.comment: Retract is moving to the retracted position

Value.name: RETRACT_STATE_DEPLOYING
Value.comment: Retract is moving to the deployed position

Value.name: RETRACT_STATE_FAULT
Value.comment: Retract is experiencing a fault condition

Data.name: Cmd
Data.comment: The current command being tracked by the retract mechanism

Data.name: State
Data.comment: The retraction mechanism state

Data.name: Pos
Data.comment: Current retract position in radians

Data.name: Flags
Data.comment: GPIO status information flags

Packet.name: StareStart
Packet.comment: This packet is transmitted by the gimbal during step-stare operations to indicate that the gimbal is staring and a step-stare image should be acquired. The position data mark the *desired* location that the gimbal is trying to stare at. The *actual* position can be computed by using the gimbal position, quaternion, and pan and tilt angles to project the camera line of sight until to the terrain model. Once the image has been acquired send a ORION_PKT_STARE_ACK packet to tell the gimbal it can move to the next stare point.

Data.name: systemTime
Data.comment: Milliseconds since system bootup. This value should be echoed in the ORION_PKT_STARE_ACK respone.

Data.name: maxStareTime
Data.comment: Seconds remaining before the stare is finished. Send ORION_PKT_STARE_ACK to terminate the stare early.

Data.name: alongTrackStare
Data.comment: If set then this is the start of an along track stare, not a cross track track stare

Data.name: prevStareTerminatedByTime
Data.comment: If set then the previous stare operation was terminated by timeout rather than an ORION_PKT_STARE_ACK packet

Data.name: stareStartedByTime
Data.comment: If set then the stare operation was initiated by timeout rather than by achieving the pan and tilt angles necessary to look at the desired location. In this instance it is possible that the actual stare location is significantly different from the desired stare location

Data.name: gimbalDataValid
Data.comment: If set then the gimbal position and attitude data are valid. If not set then only the desired stare position is valid

Data.name: stareReset
Data.comment: If set then the stare position had to be reset due to falling behind.

Data.name: prevStareTime
Data.comment: Seconds of time elapsed between the previous stare start and stare end. If this number approaches stareTime the image-acquisition system is in danger of not keeping up.

Data.name: stareLoad
Data.comment: Amount of time spent stepping and staring, as a ratio to the time between stare starts. As the frequency of stare events goes up this number will go towards 1.0, indicating the system has reached maximum utilization.

Data.name: posLat
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude of the desired stare point in radians, positive North

Data.name: posLon
Data.comment: Longitude of the desired stare point in radians, positive East

Data.name: posAlt
Data.comment: Altitude of the desired stare point in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: gimbalPosLat
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude of the gimbal in radians, positive North

Data.name: gimbalPosLon
Data.comment: Longitude of the gimbal in radians, positive East

Data.name: gimbalPosAlt
Data.comment: Altitude of the gimbal in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: gimbalQuat
Data.comment: Gimbal quaternion describing the rotation from the gimbal mount frame to the North, East, Down navigation frame

Data.name: pan
Data.comment: Gimbal pan angle in radians from -pi to pi

Data.name: tilt
Data.comment: Gimbal tilt angle in radians from -pi to pi

Data.name: rangeSource
Data.comment: Target range data source

Data.name: slantRange
Data.comment: Slant range to target, if available (see rangeSource)

Data.name: alongStareAngle
Data.comment: Angle in radians of the view of the path with respect to the perpendicular ideal view. Positive angles indicate looking ahead, negative are looking behind.

Data.name: crossStareAngle
Data.comment: Cross track angle in radians of the stare location, which will be zero if cross stepping is not being used. Negative if staring left of the path.

Packet.name: OrionResetSource
Packet.comment: Reset information for a processor in the Orion Gimbal. This packet is transmitted by each processor in the gimbal following its bootup

Data.name: Vector
Data.comment: Interrupt vector for the last reset

Data.name: Address
Data.comment: Program counter prior to the reset (not yet used)

Data.name: sourceBoard
Data.comment: Enumeration defining which board in the gimbal generated this message

Packet.name: CrownMode
Packet.comment: This packet commands a special mode of operation for the crown board. Any mode that is not 'crownModeNormal' is used for development or production purposes. When this packet is sent from the crown board it reports the current mode of operation. Request the current mode of operation by sending this packet with zero length.

Enum.name: crownModes
Enum.comment: Modes of operation for the orion crown board software.

Value.name: crownModeNormal
Value.comment: The normal operation of the crown board

Value.name: crownModeLogINS
Value.comment: Normal mode of operation except INS raw data are sent to users

Value.name: crownModePrintIMU
Value.comment: Normal mode of operation except the IMU sensors are printed out using debug packets

Value.name: crownModePrintINS
Value.comment: Normal mode of operation except the INS states are printed out using debug packets

Value.name: crownModeTempCal
Value.comment: Special mode of operation used for temperature calibration of the sensors

Value.name: crownModeIMUCal
Value.comment: Special mode of operation used for gain, bias, and alignment calibration of the IMU

Data.name: mode
Data.comment: Crown board mode of operation

Packet.name: DebugString
Packet.comment: This packet sends a human readable text string which is typically used for debugging purposes.

Enum.name: debugPriority
Enum.comment: Priority level of a debug message

Value.name: debugLevelFatal
Value.comment: Describes an unrecoverable error, highest priority

Data.name: source
Data.comment: Identifier to determine which board sent the debug packet

Data.name: priority
Data.comment: The importance of the debug message

Data.name: description
Data.comment: human readable description of the debug problem

Packet.name: KlvUserData
Packet.comment: This packet is used to set and query the values of user-configurable KLV tags

Data.name: Key
Data.comment: UAS Local Set key

Data.name: SubKey
Data.comment: UAS Local Set sub-key, if applicable (e.g., security metadata)

Data.name: Length
Data.comment: Data length, in bytes

Data.name: Value
Data.comment: Variable-length value string

Packet.name: OrionSensorData
Packet.comment: Raw sensor data from the Orion Crown board.

Data.name: Gyros
Data.comment: Measured angular rate in body axes in radians per second

Data.name: Accels
Data.comment: Measured specific force in body axes in meters per second per second

Data.name: Baro
Data.comment: Measured barometric pressure in Pascals

Data.name: OAT
Data.comment: Measured outside air temperature in degrees Kelvin

Data.name: time
Data.comment: system time stamp in milliseconds of this IMU data

Data.name: gyroTemp
Data.comment: Gyro die temperature in degrees Kelvin

Data.name: gyroDt
Data.comment: Elapsed gyro time in seconds. Use this time to compute delta angle from the gyro rate

Data.name: accelDt
Data.comment: Elapsed accelerometer time in seconds. Use this time to compute delta velocity from the specific force

Data.name: ppsAge
Data.comment: PPS pulse age in milliseconds before the system time reported in this packet

Data.name: counter
Data.comment: IMU packet counter, rolls over every 256

Enum.name: gpsSource_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for source of GPS data.

Value.name: nmeaSource
Value.comment: External GPS, supplied by NMEA input

Value.name: apntSource
Value.comment: Alternative positioning, navigation, and timing system supplied data

Enum.name: ubloxFixType_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for types of GPS solutions, derived from uBlox specification.

Value.name: timeOnly
Value.comment: Time only, no position or velocity

Data.name: multiAntHeadingValid
Data.comment: Set if the GPS has a multi antenna heading solution

Data.name: FixType
Data.comment: uBlox fix type

Data.name: FixState
Data.comment: uBlox fix state

Data.name: TrackedSats
Data.comment: The number of satellites used in the GPS solution

Data.name: PDOP
Data.comment: Position dilution of precision

Data.name: Latitude
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude in radians, positive North

Data.name: Longitude
Data.comment: Longitude in radians, positive East

Data.name: Altitude
Data.comment: Altitude in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: VelNED
Data.comment: Velocity in North, East, Down meters per second

Data.name: Hacc
Data.comment: Horizontal accuracy in meters

Data.name: Vacc
Data.comment: Vertical accuracy in meters

Data.name: SpeedAcc
Data.comment: Speed accuracy in meters per second

Data.name: HeadingAcc
Data.comment: Course accuracy in radians

Data.name: ITOW
Data.comment: GPS time of week in milliseconds

Data.name: Week
Data.comment: GPS week number since Jan 6 1980

Data.name: GeoidUndulation
Data.comment: Height of the mean seal level geoid with respect to the WGS-84 ellipsoid, in meters

Data.name: source
Data.comment: The source of the GPS data

Data.name: detailedAccuracyValid
Data.comment: Set if detailed accuracy information (posAccuracy and velAccuracy) are included in this packet

Data.name: verticalVelocityValid
Data.comment: 0 if vertical velocity data are not valid

Code.name: postReceiptUpdate1
Code.comment: Fill out non-encoded ECEF position and velocity fields

Data.name: leapSeconds
Data.comment: Leap seconds to subtract from GPS time to compute UTC time

Data.name: multiAntHeading
Data.comment: The heading in radians from the multi antenna solution from -pi to pi

Data.name: posAccuracy
Data.comment: North, East, Down position accuracy estimate in meters

Data.name: velAccuracy
Data.comment: North, East, Down velocity accuracy estimate in meters per second

Data.name: posEcef
Data.comment: Position in ECEF x,y,z meters

Data.name: velEcef
Data.comment: Velocity in ECEF x,y,z meters per second

Data.name: posEcefAccuracy
Data.comment: ECEF x,y,z position accuracy estimate in meters

Data.name: velEcefAccuracy
Data.comment: ECEF x,y,z accuracy estimate in meters per second

Data.name: Year
Data.comment: Year of the date

Data.name: Month
Data.comment: Month of the year from 1 to 12

Data.name: Day
Data.comment: Day of the month from 1 to 31

Data.name: Hour
Data.comment: Hour of the day from 0 to 23

Data.name: Minute
Data.comment: Minute of the hour from 0 to 59

Data.name: Second
Data.comment: Second of the minute from 0 to 59

Data.name: TimeValid
Data.comment: Nonzero if time information is valid

Data.name: GroundSpeed
Data.comment: Ground speed in meters per second

Data.name: GroundHeading
Data.comment: Course over ground in radians

Data.name: valid3DFix
Data.comment: Nonzero if position solution is valid and 3D

Code.name: postReceiptUpdate2
Code.comment: Fill out non-encoded ECEF uncertainty fields of this structure

Data.name: multiAntHeadingAccuracy
Data.comment: Multi-antenna heading accuracy in radians

Packet.name: InsQuality
Packet.comment: This packet is transmitted once per second by the gimbal to communicate the quality of the inertial navigation system (INS) data. The INS is responsible for fusing the crown board IMU and GPS to determine the position, velocity, attitude, and IMU errors. The quality of the INS data directly impacts the quality of the data in the GeolocateTelemetryCore packet. This data are only sent once per second as the quality data changes slowly.

Enum.name: insMode_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for the inertial navigation operational mode

Value.name: insModeRunTight
Value.comment: Normal mode of operation with tightly coupled corrections

Data.name: systemTime
Data.comment: Milliseconds since system bootup

Data.name: gpsSource
Data.comment: The source of GPS data

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved packet space

Data.name: imuType
Data.comment: IMU type

Data.name: insMode
Data.comment: The operational mode of the INS

Data.name: hasGyroBias
Data.comment: 1 if the INS is computing and reporting gyro bias states

Data.name: hasGravityBias
Data.comment: 1 if the INS is computing and reporting a gravity bias state

Data.name: hasAccelBias
Data.comment: 1 if the INS is computing and reporting accelerometer bias states

Data.name: hasClockBias
Data.comment: 1 if the INS is computing and reporting clock bias and drift states

Data.name: hasPanTiltBias
Data.comment: 1 if the INS is computing and reporting pan and tilt bias states

Data.name: posRejected
Data.comment: 1 if the INS rejected the last position update because the chi-square value was too large.

Data.name: velRejected
Data.comment: 1 if the INS rejected the last velocity update because the chi-square value was too large.

Data.name: hdgRejected
Data.comment: 1 if the INS rejected the last heading update because the chi-square value was too large.

Data.name: gpsPeriod
Data.comment: Time in seconds between GPS measurements, 0 if no measurement

Data.name: hdgPeriod
Data.comment: Time in seconds between heading measurements, 0 if no measurement

Data.name: posChiSquare
Data.comment: Chi-square statistic of the last position observation

Data.name: velChiSquare
Data.comment: Chi-square statistic of the last velocity observation

Data.name: hdgChiSquare
Data.comment: Chi-square statistic of the last heading observation

Data.name: attConfidence
Data.comment: Attitude confidence in radians as a body Roll, Pitch, Yaw vector

Data.name: velConfidence
Data.comment: Velocity confidence in meters per second as a North, East, Down vector

Data.name: posConfidence
Data.comment: Position confidence in meters as a North, East, Down vector

Data.name: gyroConfidence
Data.comment: Rate gyro bias confidence in radians per second as a body Roll, Pitch, Yaw vector

Data.name: accelConfidence
Data.comment: Accelerometer bias confidence in m/s/s as a body X, Y, Z vector

Data.name: gravityConfidence
Data.comment: Gravity bias confidence in m/s/s

Data.name: clockBiasConfidence
Data.comment: Clock bias confidence (for tightly coupled) in meters

Data.name: clockDriftConfidence
Data.comment: Clock drift confience (for tightly coupled) in meters per second

Data.name: gyroBias
Data.comment: Rate gyro bias estimate in radians per second as a body Roll, Pitch, Yaw vector

Data.name: accelBias
Data.comment: Accelerometer bias estimate in m/s/s as a body X, Y, Z vector

Data.name: gravityBias
Data.comment: Gravity bias estimate in m/s/s

Data.name: clockBias
Data.comment: Clock bias estimate (for tightly coupled) in meters

Data.name: clockDrift
Data.comment: Clock drift estimate (for tightly coupled) in meters per second

Data.name: numTightSatPosUpdates
Data.comment: Number of satellites that contributed to tightly coupled position updates

Data.name: numTightSatVelUpdates
Data.comment: Number of satellites that contributed to tightly coupled velocity updates

Data.name: numTightPosUpdates
Data.comment: Number of signals that contributed to tightly coupled position updates

Data.name: numTightVelUpdates
Data.comment: Number of signals that contributed to tightly coupled velocity updates

Data.name: panTiltBias
Data.comment: Pan and tilt boresight biases

Data.name: panTiltChiSquare
Data.comment: Pan and tilt chi-square statistic

Documentation.name: Packets for gimbal control
Documentation.comment: These packets are sent by the user to control the gimbal.

Structure.name: OrionCmd
Structure.comment: Structure for holding a gimbal axis command

Data.name: Target
Data.comment: Pan and tilt commands in radians or radians per second. Interpretation depends on Mode.

Data.name: Mode
Data.comment: Operational mode of the gimbal. Note that not all modes can be directly commanded.

Data.name: Stabilized
Data.comment: Non-zero to enable inertial stabilization. If zero then Target is with respect to the gimbal mount, otherwise Target is with respect to the inertial or image space.

Data.name: ImpulseTime
Data.comment: Amount of time in seconds for changing the gimbal position

Data.name: Cmd
Data.comment: Pan/tilt command

Packet.name: OrionStartupCmd
Packet.comment: Command to run upon motor initialization

Data.name: Cmd
Data.comment: Pan/tilt command. Defaults to position mode, pan/tilt of 0

Packet.name: OrionPositions
Packet.comment: Stored gimbal positions

Value.name: POSITION_RETRACT
Value.comment: Position to stow the gimbal at prior to retracting

Data.name: NumPositions
Data.comment: Number of pre-defined positions included in the packet

Data.name: Pan
Data.comment: Pan angle

Data.name: Tilt
Data.comment: Tilt angle

Data.name: Enabled
Data.comment: Set to 1 to enable this position

Packet.name: GeopointCmd
Packet.comment: Send this packet to command the gimbal to go to Geopoint mode. In geopoint the gimbal looks at a target as given by a latitude, longitude, altitude position. The geopoint command can include a target velocity, which will cause the gimbal to smoothly move its stare point as it propagates the target position. Geopoint mode is canceled by sending a normal OrionCmd packet.

Enum.name: geopointOptions
Enum.comment: Options controlling how the geopoint is interpreted

Value.name: geopointStare
Value.comment: If set this geopoint will issue a stare packet when it is pointing at the target location. This option is ignored if joystickRange is non-zero.

Value.name: geopointClosure
Value.comment: If set this geopoint command will cause the gimbal to enter closure mode, in which it will drive at maximum performance to achieve the desired pointing. This option is ignored if the joystickRange is non-zero.

Value.name: geopointStareClosure
Value.comment: Logical OR of geopointStare and geopointClosure.

Value.name: geopointReturnToMode
Value.comment: Set this bit to return to the current operation mode after the closure threshold is reached

Data.name: targetLat
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude of the target in radians, positive North

Data.name: targetLon
Data.comment: Longitude of the target in radians, positive East

Data.name: targetAlt
Data.comment: Altitude of the target in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: targetVelNED
Data.comment: Velocity of the target in North, East, Down meters per second

Data.name: joystickRange
Data.comment: Estimated range to target in meters. If non-zero *and* if geopoint is already running the position information in this packet is ignored and only the velocity and range information is used to propagate the geopoint command position. This is used for cases where a joystick is being used to drive the geopoint. If the gimbal has its own range estimate then a non-zero joystickRange will be replaced with the gimbal's internal range estimate. If you want the gimbal use the joystick mode but you cannot compute the range, use a range less than 10 meters and the gimbal will not do the range adjustment

Data.name: options
Data.comment: Options for the geopoint packet.

Enum.name: maxPathPoints
Enum.comment: Maximum number of points in a path.

Value.name: MAX_PATH_POINTS
Value.comment: Maximum number of points in a path

Data.name: numPoints
Data.comment: Number of points in the path

Data.name: pointDown
Data.comment: If numPoints is zero, and this is set, then the gimbal will point downwards

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved for future expansion

Data.name: numCrossTrackSteps
Data.comment: Number of steps for across track stepping. Must be more than 1 to enable cross track stepping.

Data.name: posEcef
Data.comment: ECEF position in meters

Data.name: alongTrackStepAngle
Data.comment: Angle in radians for step-stare functionality along track. Set to zero for no step-stare. If doing downward pointing the gimbal must be receiving ORION_PKT_RANGE_DATA.

Data.name: crossTrackStepRatio
Data.comment: Ratio of cross track step angle to along track step angle. Set to zero for no cross track stepping.

Packet.name: StareAck
Packet.comment: This packet tells the gimbal that the step-stare image has been acquired and the gimbal can move to the next step stare point.

Data.name: echoSystemTime
Data.comment: Milliseconds since system bootup received from ORION_PKT_STARE_START. If this value matches the value sent in ORION_PKT_STARE_START then the gimbal will terminate the stare operation early.

Packet.name: GeoidUndulation
Packet.comment: Packet for periodic geoid undulation data uplink for GPS sources without a geoid model

Packet.name: OrionCameraSwitch
Packet.comment: Command the gimbal to swtich cameras.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: The index of the camera to switch to, counting from 0

Data.name: Zoom
Data.comment: Zoom is calculated from fov as: Zoom = PixelPitch*ArrayWidth*0.5/(MinFocalLength*tan(FOV*0.5)) array width and pixel pitch come from the OrionCameras packet Sending less than 1 interprets as do not change, 1 is full wide, 2 is 2X, etc.

Data.name: Focus
Data.comment: Focus command/position on imagers with manual focus control, expected between 0 and 1.0, exactly 0 commands autofocus, -1 is don't change

Data.name: KeepActiveCamera
Data.comment: Set to 1 to maintain the currently active camera. If this bit is set to zero and the Index field does not match the currently active camera index, the gimbal will switch cameras

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: The index of the camera to command

Packet.name: OrionFlirSettings
Packet.comment: FLIR-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected FLIR camera.

Value.name: NUC_TYPE_MANUAL
Value.comment: Typical operation mode, manual FFC only

Value.name: NUC_TYPE_SSN_NO_MOTION
Value.comment: Silent shutterless NUC (SSN), no motion setting

Data.name: Palette
Data.comment: Image Colorization - 2 for Rainbow, 3 for RainbowHC, 4 for Ironbow, 5 for Lava, 6 for Arctic, 7 for Glowbow, 8 for GradedFire, 9 for Hottest

Data.name: NucType
Data.comment: NUC type setting

Data.name: BlackHot
Data.comment: Image polarity setting - set to 0 for white hot or 1 for black hot. This field is ignored if Palette is non-zero, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Data.name: MaxAgcGain
Data.comment: Maximum AGC output gain, (effective min=1, effective max=50)

Data.name: AceLevel
Data.comment: Active Contrast Enhancement (ACE) level, (default=1, effective min=-8, effective max=8)

Data.name: DdeThreshold
Data.comment: DDE spatial threshold, (default=24, effective min=1, effective max=100)

Data.name: AgcMidpoint
Data.comment: AGC output midpoint, (default=128, effective min=0, effective max=255)

Data.name: IntegrationTime
Data.comment: Integration time, in milliseconds, (default=8, effective min=2, effective max=12)

Data.name: AgcGamma
Data.comment: Agc Gamma (default = 1.0, effective min = 0.5, effective max = 4.0)

Data.name: AgcLinearPercent
Data.comment: Agc Linear Percent (default = 50.0, effective min = 0.0, effective max = 100.0)

Packet.name: OrionAptinaSettings
Packet.comment: Aptina-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected Aptina camera.

Data.name: MinExposure
Data.comment: Minimum exposure time in milliseconds, (default=0.1, effective min=0.05, effective max=33.0)

Data.name: MaxExposure
Data.comment: Maximum exposure time in milliseconds, (default=8.0, effective min=0.05, effective max=33.0)

Data.name: MinGain
Data.comment: Minimum sensor luminance gain, (default=1, effective min=1, effective max=32)

Data.name: MaxGain
Data.comment: Maximum sensor luminance gain, (default=32, effective min=1, effective max=32)

Data.name: Brightness
Data.comment: Brightness adjustment, (default=-8, effective min=-100, effective max=110)

Data.name: Contrast
Data.comment: Contrast adjustment, (default=-0.4, effective min=-1.0, effective max=1.0)

Data.name: Saturation
Data.comment: Saturation adjustment, (default=0.3, effective min=-1.0, effective max=1.0)

Data.name: Sharpness
Data.comment: Sharpening filter strength, (default=2.0, effective min=0.0, effective max=5.0)

Data.name: DebugEnable
Data.comment: Set to 1 to enable AGC debugging information, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Data.name: Hue
Data.comment: Hue adjustment, (default=0, effective min=-10, effective max=10)

Data.name: Aperture
Data.comment: Aperture command, set to 0 for auto

Data.name: MinAperture
Data.comment: Minimum aperture setting, or 0 for not supported

Data.name: MaxAperture
Data.comment: Maximum aperture setting, or 0 for not supported

Data.name: Flip
Data.comment: Set to non-zero to vertically flip the video, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Packet.name: OrionZafiroSettings
Packet.comment: Zafiro-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected Zafiro camera.

Data.name: BlackHot
Data.comment: Image polarity setting - set to 0 for white hot or 1 for black hot, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Data.name: IntegrationTime
Data.comment: Integration time, in milliseconds, (default=10.0, effective min=1.0, effective max=30.0)

Data.name: LapEnabled
Data.comment: Local Area Processing (LAP) enable/disable flag. Set to zero to disable, or non-zero to enable, (default=1, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Data.name: LapGain
Data.comment: LAP Sharpening gain, (default=2.0, effective min=0.5, effective max=4.0)

Data.name: AgcSaturation
Data.comment: AGC histogram saturation, (default=0.01, effective min=0.0, effective max=0.1)

Data.name: UseNucTablePresets
Data.comment: Set to 1 to use NUC table presets, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Packet.name: OrionHitachiSettings
Packet.comment: Hitachi-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected Hitachi camera.

Data.name: IntegrationTime
Data.comment: Integration time in microseconds, or negative to disable shutter-priority mode, (default=-1, effective min=100, effective max=16667)

Data.name: Aperture
Data.comment: Aperture f-number, or negative to disable aperture-priority mode, (default=1.4, effective min=-3276.6, effective max=3276.7)

Data.name: Sharpness
Data.comment: Sharpening filter strength, (default=1.0, effective min=0.0, effective max=5.0)

Data.name: NightMode
Data.comment: Set to 1 to remove IR cut filter, or 0 to enable it, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Packet.name: OrionSonySettings
Packet.comment: Sony-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected Sony camera.

Data.name: MinExposure
Data.comment: Minimum exposure time in milliseconds, (default=0.1, effective min=0.05, effective max=33.0)

Data.name: MaxExposure
Data.comment: Maximum exposure time in milliseconds, (default=0.1, effective min=0.05, effective max=33.0)

Data.name: MinGain
Data.comment: Minimum sensor luminance gain, in dB, (default=1)

Data.name: MaxGain
Data.comment: Maximum sensor luminance gain, in dB, (default=18)

Data.name: Brightness
Data.comment: Brightness target, from 0 to 255, (default=128, effective min=0, effective max=255)

Data.name: Contrast
Data.comment: Contrast adjustment, (default=-0.3, effective min=-1.0, effective max=1.0)

Data.name: Saturation
Data.comment: Saturation adjustment, (default=0.5, effective min=-1.0, effective max=1.0)

Data.name: Sharpness
Data.comment: Sharpening filter strength, (default=3.0, effective min=0.0, effective max=5.0)

Data.name: FrameRate
Data.comment: Camera frame rate, in Hertz, (default=30.0, effective min=1.0, effective max=30.0)

Packet.name: OrionKtncSettings
Packet.comment: KTnC-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected KTnC camera.

Data.name: IntegrationTime
Data.comment: Integration time in microseconds, or negative to disable shutter-priority mode, (default=-1, auto=-1, effective min=100, effective max=16667)

Data.name: Aperture
Data.comment: Aperture f-number, or negative to disable aperture-priority mode, (default=-1, auto=-1, effective min=1.6, effective max=32)

Data.name: Sharpness
Data.comment: Sharpening adjustment, (default=8, effective min=0, effective max=16)

Data.name: VerticalFlip
Data.comment: Set to non-zero to vertically flip the video, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Data.name: ExposureComp
Data.comment: Exposure compenstation adjustment, (default=7, effective min=0, effective max=14)

Data.name: Contrast
Data.comment: Contrast adjustment, (default=8 effective min=0, effective max=32)

Data.name: Saturation
Data.comment: Saturation adjustment, (default=14, effective min=0, effective max=32)

Data.name: NightMode
Data.comment: Night mode enable, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Data.name: ResetToDefaults
Data.comment: Reset to defaults, (default=0, effective min=0, effective max=1)

Data.name: HasMaxExposure
Data.comment: The gimbal will set this flag to 1 if MaxExposure is supported by the camera

Data.name: MaxExposure
Data.comment: Max integration time in seconds for AGC algorithm

Data.name: VersionMajor
Data.comment: Major version number of the firmware loaded on the camera

Data.name: VersionMinor
Data.comment: Minor version number of the firmware loaded on the camera

Data.name: VersionPatch
Data.comment: Patch version number of the firmware loaded on the camera

Packet.name: OrionAttolloSettings
Packet.comment: Attollo-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected Attollo camera.

Data.name: MinGain
Data.comment: Minimum AGC gain

Data.name: MaxGain
Data.comment: Maximum AGC gain

Data.name: MinExposure
Data.comment: Minimum AEC integration time

Data.name: MaxExposure
Data.comment: Maximum AEC integration time

Data.name: BlackHot
Data.comment: Image polarity setting - set to 0 for white hot or 1 for black hot

Data.name: Sharpness
Data.comment: Sharpening filter strength

Data.name: MeanTargetRange
Data.comment: valid(0-5) corisponding to 0-2000, ... , 10000-12000

Data.name: BlackPoint
Data.comment: Sets Minimum Offset Range(x1000)

Data.name: DisableSeeSpot
Data.comment: If set to 1, disable see spot process

Data.name: SeeSpotDebugOutput
Data.comment: If set to 1, enable more logging on the see spot process

Data.name: RawRecord
Data.comment: If set to 1, enable raw record of the phoenix pipeline

Data.name: Reserved0
Data.comment: Reserved bits, set to zero

Data.name: FixedLaserTriggerDelay
Data.comment: Sets a fixed trigger delay from the laser pulse to laser frame capture, set to -1 to disable

Data.name: LaserIntegrationTime
Data.comment: Sets the integration time for laser frames

Data.name: Brightness
Data.comment: Sets image brightness

Data.name: Contrast
Data.comment: Sets image contrast

Data.name: SeeSpotMode
Data.comment: Mode for see spot algorithm

Data.name: LaserGain
Data.comment: Gain on laser frame

Data.name: LaserOffset
Data.comment: Offset on laser frame

Packet.name: OrionAlviumSettings
Packet.comment: Alvium-specific camera setttings.

Packet.name: OrionOmniVisSettings
Packet.comment: OmniVision-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected OmniVis camera.

Data.name: ExpMode
Data.comment: Sets exposure mode; 0:off, 1:auto

Data.name: IsoMode
Data.comment: Sets ISO exposure mode; 0:auto, 1:deblur, 8:manual, 2-7:100 to 3200 doubles each step.

Data.name: WbMode
Data.comment: Sets white balance mode; 0:off, 3:auto, ...

Data.name: ManExpTime
Data.comment: Sets manual exposure mode time

Data.name: Brightness
Data.comment: Sets exposure compensation step or 'brightness'; -12 to 12

Data.name: Saturation
Data.comment: Sets saturation strength; 0-10

Data.name: Contrast
Data.comment: Sets contrast strength; 1-10

Data.name: Sharpness
Data.comment: Sets sharpness strength; 0-6

Data.name: NoiseReduce
Data.comment: Sets noise reduction mode; 0:off, 1:fast, 2:hq

Data.name: Scene
Data.comment: Sets camera optimizations that are scene dependent

Data.name: ControlMode
Data.comment: Overall mode of auto control routines, i.e. exposure, wbalance, focus

Data.name: Rsc
Data.comment: turns rsc on or off

Packet.name: OrionSierraSettings
Packet.comment: SierraOlympia-specific camera settings.

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected SierraOlympia camera.

Data.name: IceBrightness
Data.comment: Sets level bias value. Level bias is similar to a brightness control.

Data.name: IceGain
Data.comment: Sets gain bias value. Gain bias is similar to a contrast control.

Data.name: IceStrength
Data.comment:
Sets ICE Strength. (ICE Mode must be enabled before this command will have any effect). This command, enables the user to select an ICE strength from 0-7 in 1
 unit increments. The lowest setting is 0; the highest setting is 7. We recommend using lower
 values when looking at lower contrast scenes and higher values when looking at dynamic
 scenes.

Packet.name: VideoOptions
Packet.comment: Video output options

Data.name: Stabilized
Data.comment: Set to 1 to enable digital video stabilization, or 0 to disable

Data.name: ShowTrackBox

Data.name: ShowReticle

Documentation.name: TrackMode Description
Documentation.title: TrackMode
Documentation.comment:
Description of TrackMode
\verbatim
| Bit | Description | |--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 0..3 | TrackMode { trackMode & 0x0F = this value } | | | 0 = no change - This only impacts the Tracking Mode not any of the other flags that are part of the mode or mode2 bytes. | | | 1 = Stationary mode Used to track non-moving object (e.g. door, window, building, etc.). Disables moving target detection | | | 2 = Vehicle mode Used to track moving objects. Works best with relatively constant velocity objects such as a car | | | 3 = Person mode Used to track moving objects like people which have more erratic motion than vehicles | | | 4 = Scene mode Uses frame-to-frame registration to determine position of target. May work better than Stationary Mode for low-contrast non moving targets | | | 5 = Reserved | | | 6 = Static mode Fixed location non-moving track box | | | 7 = No Registration Use to track moving or non-moving objects when it is difficult to accurately estimate frame-to-frame registration | | | 8 = Drone mode Erratically moving quadcopters, for example. | | | 9..15 = Reserved | | 4 | High noise compensation {trackMode & 0x10 = this value } | | 5 | Acquisition assist {trackMode & 0x20 = this value } | | 6 | Intelligent assist {trackMode & 0x40 = this value } | | 7 | Reduced search {trackMode & 0x80 = this value } |
\verbatim

Documentation.name: DetectionMode Description
Documentation.title: DetectionMode
Documentation.comment:
Description of DetectionMode, For each bit: 0 disables feature, 1 enables feature. NOTE: choose only one of bits 4-11; 0 = Don't change motion mode
\verbatim
| Bit | Description | |--------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 0 | 1: Disable all (other bits ignorded) | | 1 | 1: Reset Detect - will clear all tracks, except in vehicle mode the primary track will persist | | 2 | Reserved | | 3 | Reserved | | 4 | Vehicle: Medium moving targets Indication. Note * if enabled, trackMode will need to be set to Vehicle as well | | 5 | Staring: Small Moving Target indication - for use with fixed camera or a ground motion camera that moves then 'stares' | | 6 | Aerial: Platform Small Moving Target Indication - for use with aerial moving camera | | 7 | Anomaly Detection: in color and/or intensity histofram - for use on a mobile or fixed platform | | 8 | Maritime Detect: for use on mobile or fixed platform to detect objects at sean | | 9 | Radiometric Detect - for use on a mobile or fixed platform to detect object within a specific temperature range | | 10 | Blob Detect - for use on mobile or fixed platform to detect objects that are either light or dark compared to their surroundings | | 11 | Drone: Medium Moving Target Indication for Drowns - for use on a mobile or statioary platform *Note if enabled, trackMode will be set to Drone | | 12 | Gas: Gas leak Detection : for use on a mobile of stationary platform with specialized gas leak detection camera | | 13 | Reserved | | 14 | Person; Medium Moving Target Indication - for use on a mobile or statiuonary platform *Note if enabled, trackMode will be set to Person |
\verbatim

Data.comment: Password, if required by the laser. If a password is required, it must be provided in order to change any aspect of the laser's state (e.g., enable/disable, arm/disarm, fire/deactivate

Data.name: Enable
Data.comment: Set to zero to disable the laser, or non-zero to enable it

Data.name: Arm
Data.comment: Set to zero to disarm the laser, or non-zero to arm

Data.name: Fire
Data.comment: Set to zero to deactivate the laser, or non-zero to activate it

Data.name: OnTime

Data.name: OffTime

Data.name: Type

Data.name: Enabled
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is enabled, otherwise 0

Data.name: Armed
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is armed, otherwise 0

Data.name: Active
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is active, otherwise 0

Data.name: GroundSpeedLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked due to low ground speed, otherwise 0

Data.name: AltitudeLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked due to low GPS altitude, otherwise 0

Data.name: PasswordLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked by password, otherwise 0

Data.name: ApCommLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked due to lost autopilot comms, otherwise 0

Data.name: ApFlyingLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked because the autopilot is not in a 'flying' state, otherwise 0

Data.name: BypassEnabled
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the current command is bypassing the safety interlocks, otherwise 0

Data.name: PitchAngleLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked due to a positive pitch angle, otherwise 0

Data.name: WatchdogLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser was locked due to laser command comm timeout. A new command will clear this lock

Data.name: AuxOutputStatus

Data.name: AuxOperatingMode
Data.comment: Two possible modes here, FailSafe=0, and Normal Mode=1, defaults to failSafe in cases where this laser is not connected to aux power

Data.name: VccUndervoltage
Data.comment: Flag to indicate whenever Vcc(aux supply voltage) drops bellow V_usd(undervoltage shutdown, typ = 2V Max = 2.7V), defaults to 0

Data.name: Reserved

Packet.name: OrionUartConfig
Packet.comment: This packet is used to change or request the baud rate and protocol of a UART on the crown board. Send this packet with zero bytes to request the configuration of the port that receives the request, or with 1 byte to request the configuration of a specific port. Not all port configuration options are available, the ethernet port must run the PROTOCOL_ORION protocol at either 115200 or 230400 bits per second. In general users should not change the ethernet port setup. In addition the PROTOCOL_UBLOX_GPS is not supported on any user configurable port, it is included in the protocol list only for completeness.

Enum.name: OrionProtocols_t
Enum.comment: Protocols understood by the Orion UART configuration

Value.name: PROTOCOL_DEFAULT
Value.comment: Use the default protocol. This is port dependent

Value.name: PROTOCOL_CLEVIS
Value.comment: Orion packet communications protocol specific to the clevis

Value.name: PROTOCOL_DISCOVERY
Value.comment: Discovery protocol that decides between novatel, UM7, and Sightline

Data.name: port
Data.comment: The port whose configuration should be changed or requested, use USER_DATA_PORT_CURRENT to indicate the port which received this packet

Data.name: baud
Data.comment: Baud rate bits per second. Use 0 to select the default baud rate for this port and protocol.

Data.name: protocol
Data.comment: The protocol to use for this port. If PROTOCOL_NO_CHANGE or PROTOCOL_DEFAULT are used the reply to this packet will contain the actual protocol in use

Data.name: temporary
Data.comment: A value of 0 indicates that the settings should persist across power cycles. Non-zero values will cause the new setting to be lost after power cycle

Data.name: param
Data.comment: Protocol-specific parameter, default is zero

Data.name: MinPos
Data.comment: Minimum position in radians

Data.name: MaxPos
Data.comment: Maximum position in radians

Data.name: MaxVel
Data.comment: Maximum velocity in radians per second

Data.name: MaxAccel
Data.comment: Maximum acceleration in radians per second per second

Data.name: ContCur
Data.comment: Maximum continuous current in Amps

Data.name: PeakCur
Data.comment: Maximum peak current in Amps

Data.name: PeakCurTime
Data.comment: Peak current time in seconds

Data.name: InitCur
Data.comment: Initialization current in Amps

Data.name: MaxPower
Data.comment: Maximum motor output power, in watts. Set to zero for no limit

Packet.name: InsOptions
Packet.comment: INS options give configuration options for the inertial navigation system (INS) in the gunbal. Changing the INS options will cause the INS to be restarted if the platform rotation changes. When using platform rotation note the order: First yaw about the gimbal's z-axis to create an intermediate axis. Then pitch about the intermediate y-axis to create a second intermediate axis. Finally roll about the second intermediate x-axis to reach the platform orientation. When using an IMU in the payload ball the enablePlatformRotation can still be used, but will only effect heading observations and the GPS lever arm, it will not rotate the IMU data.

Data.name: enablePlatformRotation
Data.comment: The INS will be run in the platform reference frame if this is set. The platform reference frame is defined by the rotation from the gimbal reference frame to the platform frame. Set this if the gimbal is installed such that the gimbal reference frame is often near pitch of +/- 90 degrees.

Data.name: enableCourseIsHeading
Data.comment: If set then the INS will use the course of the GPS as a heading input for initialization and heading updates when the heading confidence is poor. This is appropriate for fixed wing aircraft if enablePlatformRotation is set (or if the gimbal native axis is aligned with the aircraft axis).

Data.name: disableMagnetometer
Data.comment: If set then the INS will ignore any magnetometer measurements.

Data.name: disableGPS
Data.comment: If set then the INS will ignore any GPS measurements.

Data.name: resetINS
Data.comment: If set then the INS will be reset, all other fields of this packet are ignored in that case.

Data.name: disableGpsClockError
Data.comment: Set this to disable clock error estimation for tightly coupled INS.

Data.name: enableAccelBias
Data.comment: Set this to enable accelerometer bias estimation.

Data.name: enableTightlyCoupled
Data.comment: Set this to enable the tightly coupled INS.

Data.name: usePhaseForVelocity
Data.comment: If set the INS will use the carrier phase rate for tightly coupled velocity observations. Otherwise the tightly coupled velocity observations come from doppler shifts.

Data.name: disableL1
Data.comment: If set the INS will ignore L1 band for tightly coupled observations.

Data.name: disableL2
Data.comment: If set the INS will ignore the L2 band for tightly coupled observations.

Data.name: disableL5
Data.comment: If set the INS will ignore the L5 band for tightly coupled observations.

Data.name: elevationMask
Data.comment: Elevation mask for tightly coupled satellites

Data.name: enablePayloadIns
Data.comment: If set the IMU inputs to the INS are coming from the payload ball, not the gimbal crown. Note that enablePlatformRotation is interpreted differently in that case

Data.name: enableNonLinearHeading
Data.comment: If set then the INS will attempt to observe the heading use nonlinear methods. This may be helpful for hovering vehicles that do not have any other heading observation.

Data.name: enableSensonorMV
Data.comment: If set, and if enablePayloadIns is set, the Sensonor IMU inputs to the INS are coming from the payload ball in the HD80MV orientation.

Data.name: enableHD25PayloadINS
Data.comment: If set, and if enablePayloadIns is set, the IMU inputs to the INS are coming from the payload ball in the HD25 special orientation.

Data.name: opticalFlowSetting
Data.comment: Non-zero to enable optical flow.

Data.name: enableCustomIMURotation
Data.comment: Set to enable a custom rotation from IMU axis to INS axis. Should not be set at the same time as `enableSensonorMV`.

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: gimbalToPlatformEuler
Data.comment: Roll, Pitch, Yaw angles in radians from -pi to pi. The angles give the Euler rotation (yaw first, then pitch, then roll) from the platform reference frame into the gimbal reference frame.

Data.name: initialHeading
Data.comment: Initial heading angle in radians for the INS

Data.name: gpsLeverArm
Data.comment: X, Y, Z meters from first (primary) GPS antenna to IMU in the gimbal reference frame, or the platform reference frame if enablePlatformRotation is on

Data.name: headingObservationBiasAngle
Data.comment: For external heading observations (including magnetometer) subtract this angle in radians from the heading observation to get the heading in INS or platform frame

Data.name: secondGPSLeverArm
Data.comment: X, Y, Z meters from second GPS antenna to IMU in the gimbal reference frame, or the platform reference frame if enablePlatformRotation is on. This only applies if Novatel Align data are being received.

Data.name: alignHeadingNoise
Data.comment: Sensor noise in radians for align heading observation. Use zero for the default sensor noise from the Align hardware.

Data.name: imuToInsEuler
Data.comment: Roll, Pitch, Yaw angles in radians from -pi to pi. The angles give the Euler rotation (yaw first, then pitch, then roll) from the INS reference frame into the IMU reference frame.

Data.comment: MJPEG quality value, from 10 to 95

Data.name: SaveSettings
Data.comment: Set to 1 to make h.264 settings non-volatile, or 0 to reset to defaults on startup

Data.name: TsPacketCount
Data.comment: Number of TS packets per UDP packet, or 0 for no change

Data.name: FramePeriod
Data.comment: Set to 0 for no change, or set to N, where the encoder will only render every Nth input frame

Data.name: KlvMode
Data.comment: Active KLV encoding method

Packet.name: OrionCameras
Packet.comment: Camera definitions for the Orion gimbal

Data.name: NumCameras
Data.comment: The number of cameras installed

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: Gpio
Data.comment: IO line to activate the camera

Data.name: GpioActiveState
Data.comment: Polarity of Gpio

Data.name: Type
Data.comment: The type of camera

Data.name: Proto
Data.comment: The communications protocol of the camera

Data.name: MinFocalLength
Data.comment: Minimum focal length in millimeters

Data.name: MaxFocalLength
Data.comment: Minimum focal length in millimeters

Data.name: PixelPitch
Data.comment: Spacing of pixels in millimeters

Data.name: ArrayWidth
Data.comment: Number of horizontal pixels in the focal plane array

Data.name: ArrayHeight
Data.comment: Number of vertical pixels in the focal plane array

Data.name: FrameRate
Data.comment: Frequency at which images are coming off the camera

Data.name: AlignMin
Data.comment: boresight alignment offsets in radians

Data.name: AlignMax
Data.comment: boresight alignment offsets in radians

Documentation.name: Packets used to determine manufacturing and software information about the gimbal
Documentation.comment: These informational packets are sent by the gimbal in response to user request. To request a specific packet, send that packet to the gimbal with zero length.

Packet.name: OrionClevisVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the clevis board in the Orion gimbal.

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the clevis board software

Data.name: PartNumber
Data.comment: Hardware details of the clevis board

Data.name: OnTime
Data.comment: Board on time in minutes

Packet.name: OrionCrownVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the crown board in the Orion gimbal.

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the crown board software

Data.name: PartNumber
Data.comment: Hardware details of the crown board

Data.name: OnTime
Data.comment: Board on time in minutes

Packet.name: OrionPayloadVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the payload board in the Orion gimbal.

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the payload board software

Data.name: PartNumber
Data.comment: Hardware details of the payload board

Data.name: OnTime
Data.comment: Board on time in minutes

Data.name: HwType
Data.comment: Hardware type identifier, or -1 if unknown

Data.name: HwRevision
Data.comment: Hardware revision identifier, or -1 if unknown

Packet.name: OrionTrackerVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the tracker board in the Orion Gimbal (if applicable)

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the tracker board software

Data.name: PartNumber
Data.comment: Hardware details of the tracker board

Data.name: AppBits
Data.comment: Tracker application license bitfield

Packet.name: OrionRetractVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the retract board in the Retract Unit (if applicable)

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the retract board software

Packet.name: OrionLensCtlVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the retract board in the Retract Unit (if applicable)

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the retract board software

Packet.name: OrionBoard
Packet.comment: Information for a specific board in the gimbal.

Data.name: boardSN
Data.comment: Serial number of this board

Data.name: assemblySN
Data.comment: Serial number of the whole assembly. This field deprecated Removal for 25.2

Data.name: config
Data.comment: Configuration bits

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future things

Data.name: boardEnum
Data.comment: Enumeration defining which board in the gimbal this data applies to

Data.name: manufactureDate
Data.comment: Date the board was manufactured

Data.name: calibrationDate
Data.comment: Date the board was calibrated

Packet.name: Product
Packet.comment: Information for a specific trillium product.

Data.name: partNumber
Data.comment: Part number for the product

Data.name: serialNumber
Data.comment: Serial number for the product. Replaces board packet assemblySN.

Data.name: productName
Data.comment: Name of the product.

Documentation.name: Packets for external sensor inputs
Documentation.comment: These optional packets can be sent to the gimbal to provide external sensor information.

Packet.name: OrionAutopilotData
Packet.comment: Autopilot state data. The gimbal will use this information to limit certain operations, for example some lasers will not fire unless the autopilot is flying with sufficient altitude above ground.

Data.name: Reserved
Data.comment: Reserved bits, set to zero

Data.name: HasIAS
Data.comment: Set to 1 if this message includes IAS, otherwise set to zero

Data.name: HasTAS
Data.comment: Set to 1 if this message includes TAS, otherwise set to zero

Data.name: IsFlying
Data.comment: Set to 1 if flying, otherwise 0

Data.name: CommGood
Data.comment: Set to 1 if AP comms are good, otherwise 0

Data.name: Agl
Data.comment: Altitude above ground level in meters. Invalid if less than zero

Data.name: IAS
Data.comment: Indicated airspeed (IAS), in m/s

Data.name: TAS
Data.comment: True airspeed (TAS), in m/s

Packet.name: OrionExtHeadingData
Packet.comment: Externally supplied heading information. Send this packet to supply a correction to the heading of the inertial navigation system of the gimbal. This packet will be echoed back to the user if INS logging is enabled.

Data.name: extHeading
Data.comment: External true heading observation in radians from -pi to pi

Data.name: noise
Data.comment: Sensor noise of the heading observation in radians. Send 0 to cause the INS to simply shift its heading. Otherwise the extHeading will be fed into the INS kalman filter with this sensor noise.

Data.name: headingInGimbalAxis
Data.comment: Set this if the provided heading is in gimbal native axis rather than the platform axis. This will cause the gimbal to rotate the heading reference as needed to the platform axis used by the INS. This will have no effect if the INS options do not specify a platform rotation.

Data.name: headingFromAlign
Data.comment: Set this if the provided heading came from an align system.

Data.name: pitch
Data.comment: Pitch angle in radians from -pi to pi of the vector used to compute heading.

Data.name: range
Data.comment: Range to target in meters

Data.name: maxAgeMs
Data.comment: Maximum data age before expiration in milliseconds

Data.name: source
Data.comment: Source of range information

Data.name: PRF
Data.comment: Detected PRF value

Data.name: panAngle
Data.comment: Pan angle from gimbal pos to detected signal, + is right

Data.name: tiltAngle
Data.comment: Tilt angle from gimbal pos to detected signal, + is up

Packet.name: OrionPRFDetects
Packet.comment: Command and control for PRF detecting gimbals

Data.name: detectState
Data.comment: Set to zero to disable PRF detect, set to 1 to enable, set to 2 for faux

Data.name: fauxSequence
Data.comment: Sequence of faux PRFs when using faux PRF mode. Nibbles 0-2 are the first PRF value, 3-6 and so on

Data.name: trackState
Data.comment: Set to zero to disable track, set to 1 to track

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved bytes

Data.name: detects
Data.comment: Current detects

Packet.name: OrionScanPlan
Packet.comment: Command and control for Orion Scan Plan

Data.name: enabled
Data.comment: command Enabled/disabled state

Data.name: horizontalScan
Data.comment: If ture gimbal will scan horizonally else it will scan veritcally

Data.name: usePercentHorizon
Data.comment: If true switch to horizon scan mode, if enabled max distance ignored and

Data.name: useTargetHfov
Data.comment: command Use Target HFOV

Data.name: referenceFrame
Data.comment: Coordinate System Frame

Data.name: enableAutonomousRate
Data.comment: Enables autonomous control of HFOV rate

Data.name: sweepAngleDeg
Data.comment: Max sweep angle in degrees

Data.name: hfovRateDeg
Data.comment: Max sweep Rate in degress deg/s

Data.name: hfovDeg
Data.comment: hfov in degs (controls the zoom)

Data.name: maxTargetDistanceKm
Data.comment: Max distance to target in Km

Data.name: minTargetDistanceKm
Data.comment: Min distance to target in Km

Data.name: horizonPercent
Data.comment: Percent of horizon in hfov

Data.name: yawOffsetDeg
Data.comment: Yaw offset in degress
